tit.cmt: タイトルですので、他と合わせてカッコ内は削除しました。

sen.j: 宗像三女神（むなかたさんじょじん）は、宗像大社（福岡県宗像市）に祀られている三柱の女神の総称である。
sen.e: Munakata Sanjojin is a collective name for Mihashira no menokami (three female gods) enshrined at Munakata-taisha Shrine (Munakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
Munakata Sanjojin is a collective name for Mihashira no menokami (three female gods) enshrined at Munakata-taisha Shrine (Munakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
Munakata Sanjojin (Three Goddesses of Munakata) is a collective name for Mihashira no menokami (three female gods) enshrined at Munakata-taisha Shrine (Munakata City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 宗像三女神→(Three Goddesses of Munakata) とここで補足しました。

sen.j: また、朝鮮への海上交通の平安を守護する玄界灘の神として、ヤマト王権によって古くから重視された神々である。
sen.e: They are deities who have been highly valued since the ancient times by the Yamato Court as the goddesses of Genkai-nada Sea, protecting maritime traffic to Korea.
They are deities who have been highly valued since the ancient times by the Yamato Court as the goddesses of Genkai-nada Sea, protecting maritime traffic to Korea.

They are deities who have been highly valued since the ancient times by the Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) as the goddesses of Genkai-nada Sea, protecting maritime traffic to Korea.
sen.cmt: ヤマト王権 表現を変更しました。

sen.j: ムナカタの表記は、『記・紀』では胸形・胸肩・宗形の文字で表している。
sen.e: Munakata is written in the "Kiki' (the Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)) with various Chinese characters for munakata.
Munakata is written in the "Kiki' (the Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)) with various Chinese characters for munakata.
Munakata is written in the "Kiki" (Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)) with various Chinese characters.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションマークを追加しました。

sen.j: 『古事記』に「この三柱の神は、胸形君等のもち拝（いつ）く三前（みまえ）の大神なり」とある。
sen.e: It is written in the "Kojiki" that 'these Mihashira no kami (three goddesses) are the three great goddesses before which Munakata no kimi worships.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is written in the "Kojiki" that 'these Mihashira no kami (three goddesses) are the three great goddesses before which Munakata no kimi worships.'
It is written in the "Kojiki" that 'these Mihashira no kami (three goddesses) are the three great goddesses before which Munakata no kimi worships.'

sen.j: 胸形氏ら海人集団の祭る神であった。
sen.e: Therefore, they were gods worshipped by groups of fishermen such as the Munakata clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, they were gods worshipped by groups of fishermen such as the Munakata clan.
Therefore, they were gods worshipped by groups of fishermen such as the Munakata clan.

sen.j: それが、朝鮮半島との緊密化により、土着神、地方神であった三神が5世紀以降国家神として祭られるようになった。
sen.e: Because of the closer relationship that developed with Korea, the three goddesses, who were native and local deities, came to be worshipped as national deities after the fifth century.
Because of the closer relationship that developed with Korea, the three goddesses, who were native and local deities, came to be worshipped as national deities after the fifth century.
Because of the closer relationship that developed with Korea, the three goddesses, who were native and local deities, came to be worshipped as national deities after the fifth century.

sen.j: 『記紀』の記す日本神話においては、アマテラスとスサノオの誓約において、アマテラスがスサノオの十拳剣を譲り受けて生んだとされている。
sen.e: According to the Japanese mythology found in the "Kiki," Amaterasu gave birth to them after she received Totsuka no Tsurugi (The Sword Ten Hands Long) of Susanoo upon making a vow of Amaterasu and Susanoo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the Japanese mythology found in the "Kiki," Amaterasu gave birth to them after she received Totsuka no Tsurugi (The Sword Ten Hands Long) of Susanoo upon making a vow of Amaterasu and Susanoo.

According to the Japanese mythology found in the "Kiki," Amaterasu gave birth to them after she received Totsuka no Tsurugi (The Sword Ten Hands Long) of Susanoo upon making a vow of Amaterasu and Susanoo.

sen.j: スサノオの物実（ものざね）から化生したのでスサノオの子としている。
sen.e: Because they were born from monozane (media from which gods are born) they are considered to be Susanoo's children.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because they were born from monozane (media from which gods are born) they are considered to be Susanoo's children.
Because they were born from monozane (media from which gods are born) they are considered to be Susanoo's children.

sen.j: 降臨の地は、福岡県の宗像地方東端の鞍手郡鞍手町の六ヶ岳という山である。
sen.e: The place upon which they descended is a mountain called Mutsugatake Mountain in Kuratemachi, Kurate-gun, located at the eastern edge of the Munakata area of Fukuoka Prefecture.
The place upon which they descended is a mountain called Mutsugatake Mountain in Kuratemachi, Kurate-gun, located at the eastern edge of the Munakata area of Fukuoka Prefecture.
The place upon which they descended is a mountain called Mt. Mutsuga-take in Kurate-machi, Kurate-gun, located at the eastern edge of the Munakata area of Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: また、日本書紀には、天照大神が国つくりの前に、宗像三神に「宗像地方から朝鮮半島や支那大陸へつながる海の道は降って、歴代の天皇をお助けすると共に歴代の天皇から篤いお祭りを受けられよ」と示した。
sen.e: Furthermore, according to Nihonshoki, prior to creating a nation Amaterasu indicated to the Munakata sanjin to 'descend upon the sea route from the Munakata area to the Korean Peninsula and the Continent of China, help successive emperors, and at the same time, receive veneration from successive emperors.'

Furthermore, according to Nihonshoki, prior to creating a nation Amaterasu indicated to the Munakata sanjin to 'descend upon the sea route from the Munakata area to the Korean Peninsula and the Continent of China, help successive emperors, and at the same time, receive veneration from successive emperors.'

Furthermore, according to Nihonshoki, prior to creating a nation Amaterasu indicated to the Munakata sanjin to 'descend upon the sea route from the Munakata area to the Korean Peninsula and the Continent of China, help successive emperors, and at the same time, receive veneration from successive emperors.'

sen.j: このことから、三女神は現在のそれぞれの地に降臨し、祀されるようになった。
sen.e: Based on this, the three goddesses descended to their respective places that exist today, and then they were worshipped.
Based on this, the three goddesses descended to their respective places where they exist today, and where they are worshipped.
Based on this, the three goddesses descended to their respective places where they exist today, and where they are worshipped.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の一書には天照大神が「汝三神（いましみはしらのかみ）、道の中に降りて居（ま）して天孫（あめみま）を助け奉（まつ）りて、天孫の為に祭られよ」との神勅を授けたと記されている。
sen.e: In one section of "Nihonshoki," it is noted that Amaterasu gave them the divine command, 'Imashi Mihashira no kami, descend on and reside in the path, aid amemima (grandson of the sun goddess) and be worshipped by amemima.'

In one section of "Nihonshoki," it is noted that Amaterasu gave them the divine command, 'Imashi Mihashira no kami, descend on and reside in the path, aid amemima (grandson of the sun goddess) and be worshipped by amemima.'

In one section of "Nihonshoki," it is noted that Amaterasu gave them the divine command, 'Imashi Mihashira no Kami, descend on and reside in the path, aid amemima (grandson of the sun goddess) and be worshipped by amemima.'
sen.cmt: 神名表現を統一しました。
小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 古事記では、化生した順に以下の三神としている。
sen.e: In the Kojiki, the three goddesses are considered to have been born in the following order.
In the Kojiki, the three goddesses are considered to have been born in the following order.
In the Kojiki, the three goddesses are considered to have been born in the following order.

sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加し、Okino-shima としました。コロンを追加しました。

sen.j: - タキリビメ（たきりびめ） 別名 奥津島比売命（おきつしまひめ）

sen.j: 玄界灘に浮かぶ沖ノ島に沖津宮があり、田心姫を祭っている。
sen.e: Tagorihime is enshrined at Okitsu-miya Shrine on Okinoshima Island located in Genkai-nada Sea.

sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加し、「-hime」 としました。

sen.j: この島には古代の祭祀跡があり、出土品は一括して国宝に指定されている（宗像大社所有）。
sen.e: There is a ruin of an ancient ritual site on this island, and the excavated items are all designated as national treasures (belonging to Munakata-taisha Shrine).
There is a ruin of an ancient ritual site on this island, and the excavated items are all designated as national treasures (belonging to Munakata-taisha Shrine).
There is a ruin of an ancient ritual site on this island, and the excavated items are all designated as national treasures (belonging to Munakata-taisha Shrine).

sen.e: The following is according to the history of the Munakata-taisha Shrine.
The following is according to the history of the Munakata-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: （三女神の神名や配列などに 古来、種々の変遷もあったが現在では以下のようになっている。）
sen.e: (There have been various changes in the names and the order of the three goddesses since the ancient times, but currently they are as follows.)

sen.j: 宗像三女神を祭神とする全国の神社
sen.e: Shrines in Japan that enshrine the Munakata Sanjojin
Shrines in Japan that enshrine the Munakata Sanjojin
Shrines in Japan that enshrine the Munakata Sanjojin

sen.j: 海の神・航海の神として信仰されている。
sen.e: They are worshipped as goddesses of the sea and sea voyage.
They are worshipped as goddesses of the sea and sea voyage.
They are worshipped as goddesses of the sea and sea voyage.

sen.j: 宗像大社のほか、厳島神社（広島県廿日市市宮島町）、田島神社（佐賀県唐津市呼子町）、および各地の宗像神社・厳島神社・八王子社・天真名井社で祀られている。
sen.e: Beside Munakata-taisha Shrine they are enshrined at Itsukushima-jinja Shrine (Miyajima-cho, Hatsukaichi City, Hiroshima Prefecture), Tajima-jinja Shrine (Yobuko-cho, Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture), as well as in other Munakata-jinja Shrines, Itsukushima-jinja Shrines, Hachioji-sha Shrines and Amanomanai-sha Shrines in various places.

Beside Munakata-taisha Shrine they are enshrined at Itsukushima-jinja Shrine (Miyajima-cho, Hatsukaichi City, Hiroshima Prefecture), Tajima-jinja Shrine (Yobuko-cho, Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture), as well as in other Munakata-jinja Shrines, Itsukushima-jinja Shrines, Hachioji-sha Shrines and Amanomanai-sha Shrines in various places.

Beside Munakata-taisha Shrine they are enshrined at Itsukushima-jinja Shrine (Miyajima-cho, Hatsukaichi City, Hiroshima Prefecture), Tajima-jinja Shrine (Yobuko-cho, Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture), as well as in other Munakata-jinja Shrines, Itsukushima-jinja Shrines, Hachioji-sha Shrines and Amanomanai-sha Shrines in various places.

sen.j: 宗像・厳島系の神社は、日本で5番目に多いとされている。
sen.e: The shrines that belong to the Munakata and Itsukushima lines are the fifth most numerous shrines in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The shrines that belong to the Munakata and Itsukushima lines are the fifth most numerous shrines in Japan.
The shrines that belong to the Munakata and Itsukushima lines are the fifth most numerous shrines in Japan.

sen.j: そのほとんどが大和及び伊勢、志摩から熊野灘、瀬戸内海を通って大陸へ行く経路に沿った所にある。
sen.e: Most of them are located on the path from Yamato, Ise and Shima to the continent through the Kumano-nada Sea and Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Most of them are located on the path from Yamato, Ise and Shima to the continent through the Kumano-nada Sea and Seto Inland Sea.
Most of them are located on the path from Yamato, Ise and Shima to the continent through the Kumano-nada Sea and Seto Inland Sea.

sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 宗像大社および、全国各地にある宗像神社
sen.e: Munakata-taisha Shrine and the Munakata-jinja Shrines throughout Japan
